work.cod_n: not sure if E Yuc involved

data.name: Sp Siege of Fr Tortuga
data.desc: San Domingo military expedition against Fr Tortuga
data.agents_sp: Gabriel Roxas de Valle-Figueroa 5 Vessels 400 infantry
data.note:
According to a Spanish MS., there were in Tortuga in 1653 700 French inhabitants, more than 200 negroes, and 250 Indians with their wives and children. The negroes and Indians were all slaves; the former seized on the coasts of Havana and Cartagena, the latter brought over from Yuc. /v Haring [missg] fn 116 /Add MS 13992
 Fr under de Fontenay retire to Port Margot in 2 ships /v Haring 83
 Summer 1652 Tortuga. Fr naval officer Timol√©on Hotman, Chevalier de Fontenay, assumes Gov of Tortuga, and shortly thereafter begins issuing privateering licences against Sp /v Marley P 1 438
 Dating = 4 Dec 1653 to 20 Feb 1654 from departure of ships from Sto Domingo to departure of Fr fm Tortuga /v Marley P 1 438
